Unpopular Opinion? - Python Typing Is Not Worth It - Diego Rodriguez-Losada - ACCU 2025 Short Talks
---

Is Python typing truly worth the hype? In this lightning talk, Diego Rodriguez-Losada challenges the growing pressure to adopt static typing in Python. With a decade of experience maintaining a critical, widely-used, mostly untyped Python project, Diego shares why static typing might not be the best choice for every developer or codebase.

Typing is often promoted as a way to catch bugs and improve code clarity, but is that always true? What about tools like mypy? Are type annotations helping readers or writers? What if Python typing starts to look more like Rust or Kotlin without offering their benefits?

This talk explores dynamic vs static typing, the value (and tradeoffs) of Python type annotations, and why developers should be free to choose what works for them—without stigma. Diego offers an honest, experience-based critique
title: Unpopular Opinion? - Python Typing Is Not Worth It - Diego Rodriguez-Losada - ACCU 2025 Short Talks
